intro: Haageocereus albispinus var. roseospinus, commonly known as the rose-spined hedgehog cactus, is a species native to Mexico. It is a small, spineless cactus that typically grows to a height of about 10–20 centimeters. The plant features a globular to cylindrical stem with a greenish-gray color and produces yellow flowers during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun exposure. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in arid gardens.
